mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Eleanor Stuart to Tobias Lear, probably 1790 February 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Stuart, Eleanor Calvert Custis, approximately 1758-1811
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter in the hand of Eleanor Calvert Custis Stuart and most likely addressed to Tobias Lear. The letter is dated 7 February with no year but was most likely written in 1790, since it mentions Lear's first marriage, which occured in 1790. Admonishes the six month delay in his response and the accompanying weak excuse for the delay-concerned about well being of Washy and Nelly in a big city--wishes Lear keep an eye on Washy--Lear's impending marriage--mutual friends in Virginia--upcoming Birth-Night Ball--frozen river. Autograph letter, 4 pages, unsigned.
